title: Energy and Greenhouse Gas Intensity
synopsis: Energy includes primary process energy plus transportation; it does not include feedstock energy value. Feedstock (caloric value) energy is not included as a typical end-of-life outcome or strategy for Nike Footwear and Apparel groups, so the impact evaluation does not include energy recovery.

title: Environmental Indicator Scores
synopsis: To align the index with Nike’s long-term sustainability goals and reward suppliers for participating in specific sustainability efforts, we added Qualitative Indicators to the Nike MSI scoring framework.

synopsis: You can add references to other Federated Wiki sites. Here we show what a reference looks like.

title: Material-Specific Data
synopsis: Each material is assigned a Base Material Score using Life Cycle Inventory information that covers the life cycle from Cradle to Gate.

title: Materials Sustainability Index
synopsis: The origin and manufacture of raw materials account for up to 60 percent of the environmental impacts of apparel and footwear products.

title: Nike Green Chemistry Program
synopsis: A page with 0 paragraphs.

title: Nike Green Chemistry Program Validation - Material Greening Effort
synopsis: The goal of the Nike material chemistry program is to protect consumers, workers, the environment and brand reputation.

title: Physical Waste
synopsis: Solid waste is the waste generated from raw material or chemical origin to yarn, based on aggregating the European Union waste categories used in Eco-Profiles. Eco-Profile data is available for commonly used fossil–fuel-based fibers and for some bio-based fibers. The waste is divided into the following categories: Hazardous, Municipal, Industrial, Recyclable/Compostable, and Mineral.

title: Smallest Federated Wiki
synopsis: Our new wiki innovates three ways. It shares through federation, composes by refactoring and wraps data with visualization. Follow our open development on GitHub or just watch our work in progress videos here.

title: Supplier Performance
synopsis: Qualitative Indicators are divided into two parts, Environmental Indicators and Supplier Practices.

title: Sustainability Certifications and Programs
synopsis: We encourage material suppliers to participate in sustainability programs and third-party certifications across a variety of environmental management systems and protocols. This effort represents active participation and better practices within the material supply chain.

title: Tier 2 Material Scores
synopsis: Here we will enumerate the materials by name and link to individual pages for each material. Individual material pages will describe how we arrived at particular sustainability scores.

title: Water and Land Use Intensity
synopsis: Water includes primary process water, such as irrigation for agricultural crops, and does not include water used in transportation; where PlasticsEurope Eco-Profile  data are used, water includes cooling water.
